title: The Writer's Almanac - Tuesday, August 18, 2020
description: It's the 100th anniversary of the ratification of the 19th Amendment, which stated that U.S. citizens' right to vote could not be "denied or abridged...on account of sex."
itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
itunes:subtitle: It's the 100th anniversary of the ratification of the 19th Amendment, which stated that U.S. citizens' right to vote could not be "denied or abridged...on account of sex."
